bug.short_desc: pitivi is installed but fails to run
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: On a Fedora 26 (alpha) system, pitivi is installed successfully, but fails to run when invoked. It says: "ERROR - The following hard dependencies are unmet: ================================================== - gstgtk not found on the system"
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): pitivi-0.98-6.fc26.x86_64
How reproducible: Install pitivi as per usual mode (dnf install pitivi) and it succeeds. Running it causes it to fail throwing out the exception of not being able to have gstgtk in the system.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Fresh Fedora 26 alpha 2. Install pitivi 3. start pitivi
Actual results: the error message that sayt that gstgtk is not found in the system.
Expected results: pitivi should run in the GUI mode
Additional info: This behaviour is seen on systems that were upgraded from Fedora 25 which had pitivi running fine.
pitivi-0.98-7.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-1e49098bd5
